tweets.text: Just to remind you all that just 24 hours ago the @EnvAgency admitted it will no longer be publishing serious pollution incidents and won't be recording them against their annual performance targets. https://t.co/Cu3VPjycTa

Flooding can have devastating emotional and financial effects. It can harm your health and well-being, damage your property, and put lives at risk.

Make sure you are prepared 👇

https://t.co/zYtctBt6eE https://t.co/Yv2N7wXJZC

Here's the latest progress on our work to upgrade the Sheaf screen in #Sheffield. This trash screen is used to collect debris and reduce the risk of #flooding to Sheffield city centre. @EnvAgency @OliverHarmarEA https://t.co/YBzYuCNEme

Rain 🌧️ is still expected throughout the day in #Cumbria. Stay safe, always keep your distance from swollen rivers and don’t drive through flood water. 

just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car 🚗

#Prepareactsurvive https://t.co/ruBakdutZ9

If you go down to the stream again you're sure of a big surprise - not with @thameswater Clanfield, Oxfordshire spilling for months last winter and again this one. Just different condoms and sanitary towels. https://t.co/TbRPohWDck

With a number of flood alerts and flood warnings still in place across #Cumbria, do you know your flood risk? 👉https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn

To find out more about the current situation, listen to our Flood and Coastal Risk Manager for #Cumbria @stewart_mounsey @BBC_Cumbria at 7:40am https://t.co/H6stg3M6Oo

tweets.text:
Let's just recap on that shall we. 

70% of our chalk streams are over abstracted, not a single river in the country meets 'Good' overall environmental health and in 2019 water companies spent 1.5 million hours dumping sewage into England's rivers.

Welcome to regulatory failure. https://t.co/z41FkduAyp

tweets.text: Crews have attended a tractor fire this afternoon. Support also provided from @DorsetTraffic & @BCPCouncil to make the scene safe. https://t.co/TjHvC7CHgE https://t.co/QRuh6Lde5l

urls.title: HebWeb News 2021 - New bursary to help students researching flood management
urls.description: A new annual bursary has been set up to support Master's students investigating natural flood management. The bursary is named in recognition of the work of the founder of Treesponsibility and The Source Partnership, Penny Eastwood, otherwise known as Dongria Kondh.

tweets.text: There will come a day when, one by one, we set about removing the dams and weirs which straightjacket our rivers. We must rewild our rivers. https://t.co/JzTj6ExvR2

urls.title: Environment Agency silent on removal of pollution goal from performance report
urls.description: The Environment Agency will not be drawn on why it has dropped a target to reduce the number of pollution incidents from a regular report on its performance against environmental objectives, despite requests for an explanation from ENDS.

urls.title: Extinction: Freshwater fish in 'catastrophic' decline
urls.description: Numbers are plunging due to pollution, unsustainable fishing and the draining of rivers.

domain.name: Person
domain.description: Named people in the world like Nelson Mandela

domain.name: Politician
domain.description: Politicians in the world, like Joe Biden

tweets.text:
And numbers of migratory freshwater fish – which include salmon, trout and eels – have also fallen by 76 per cent as, the report says, cities treat rivers as mere ‘pipes’ to provide water, power and industry.

Time is now for the government to take action to reverse the decline.

They never respond @oliverpitt they never engage with river campaigners,  @EnvAgency bosses inhabit an ivory tower, dispensing platitudes and spin while our fish hurtle towards extinction https://t.co/aTSd121YR6

@Rachel_A_ @GreenFeltham @EnvAgency @thameswater @Thames21 @SE_Rivers_Trust Good luck with the environment agency. We have been reporting a similar situation in the river this end for a looooong time. This is why we end up doing it ourselves.

In this nest, two of the Brook Lampreys work together to shift stones. The third, with a huge effort tries in vain to move another rock - then flops in exhaustion. #Lakenheath #Suffolk #Fenland #Lampreys #ForgottenFishes @OuseEcologyEA @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency @OSBrecks  
3/7 https://t.co/iP95TYUv80

tweets.text: @BenGoldsmith That work is well underway in Cumbria already, Ben. @EdenRiversTrust, @WestCumbriaRT, @SCRiversTrust, @UllswaterCic, @WildHaweswater and @nationaltrust working together with @EnvAgencyNW & @NECumbria have removed loads of barriers & remeandered many miles of river.

Yesterday with the PM I visited Didsbury where properties were evacuated following #StormChristoph. @EnvAgency’s flood defences held firm and 23,000 properties in Greater Manchester were protected. Here’s a blog about that + how it relates to #COP26: https://t.co/1BXemM9lnp https://t.co/0WakFBAJbk

urls.title: Thames Estuary 2100: 10-Year Review monitoring key findings
urls.description: We use some essential cookies to make this website work. We’d like to set additional cookies to understand how you use GOV.UK, remember your settings and improve government services. We also use cookies set by other sites to help us deliver content from their services. Where we have identified any third party copyright information you will need to obtain permission from the copyright holders concerned. This publication is available at https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/thames-estuary-2100-te2100/tha
